title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chest", February 24, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in stamp in graphite, lower right: 8562/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLMAN/D./2/24/37, 3/3/37, 1, MASTER CR.; inscribed in graphite, left of stamp: CHEST 9'0 LONG 18" DEEP35 1/2" HIGH./BOMBAY ROSEWOOD & CAL. REDWOOD BURL/INTERIOR BLEACHED SYCAMORE OR HOLLY/PULLS - METAL SPINNING -POL. CHROM. FACE OF KNOBS REDWOOD BURL/WOOD OF KNOBS TO MATCH REDWOOD/4 DOOR/BEHIND LEFT PAIR OF DOORS - TWO DRAWERS ON EXT. SLIDES/AND ONE ADJUSTABLE SHELF/BEHIND RIGHT PAIR OF DOORS - FOUR DRAWERS ON EXT. SLIDES/ON RIGHT END OF CHEST FOUR DRAWERS WITH CENTRE DRAWER GUIDES/TOP DRAWER TO HAVE TRAY & DIVIDERS/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES ALSO TOP EDGES OF DRAWERS & DOORS/DOORS TO HAVE BULLET CATCHES /PROVIDE STOPPERS FOR ALL DRAWERS /USE DOMES OF SILENCE/SPEC. STRONG HINGES
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for sideboard/chest. Long, horizontal sideboard with two sets of cabinet doors towards left, and two other cabinet doors near center. Doors have circular pulls near center. Cabinet at left has two interior drawers and adjustable shelf. Cabinet at center has four interior drawers. At right end of sideboard are four drawers; top drawer has tray and dividers. Right side, top, and base of sideboard in Bombay rosewood; cabinet doors in California redwood burl.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chest", February 24, 1937.
February 24, 1937. Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-965.
